title: Anyone knows how to say "pilcrow" in Latin?
content:
Welcome everybody,

I have been wondering for a while what is the Latin name for the pilcrow... I am looking for a good name for my book design company that I am about to establish; I’ve had lots of ideas, unfortunately, as it is common with ideas - many people have them, and the choice is not so satisfactory.

Eh, anyway, could anyone help me with this? I am getting a bit desperate.

Thanks in advance,

przemek debowski

 [‹ Did we miss Dan Weaver and Eric West's Birthday?](http://web.archive.org/web/20071121095431/http:/www.typophile.com/node/16460 "Go to previous forum topic") [The Romantic period (18th & 19th C) ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071121095431/http:/www.typophile.com/node/16140 "Go to next forum topic")
author: elko

comments.content:
I think maybe it’s Capitolum. Anyway, you  
can find it in “Pause and Effect” (M B Parkes).

BTW, a really cool name for the Pilcrow is  
the Spanish one: Calderon. It sounds like  
some really serious planet or something.

hhp

“It sounds like  
some really serious planet or something.”

or else MacBeth: “...Fire burn and Calderon bubble!”

ChrisL
Who’s this Derron I’m supposed to call about the fonts?

<cite>or else MacBeth: “…Fire burn and Calderon bubble!”</cite>

or [Clarendon!](http://web.archive.org/web/20071121095431/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&font_categories_search=font_name_search&searchstr=clarendon&image.x=0&image.y=0)

I didn’t know that “calderon” is the Spanish one, in Italian if we say “calderone” it means “a group of messed up things”, “putting together ideas in a confused way”; if we say “to put everything in the same ’calderone’” then it means “to consider/mistake different discordant things in the same way”. What about “Dostaa” ? I loved Chimera restaurant in Krakow.

Szczescie,  
AS

Here is a definition from Wikipeda. Lots of words in here.  
 [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pilcrow](http://web.archive.org/web/20071121095431/http:/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pilcrow)
